title: Rename query modules to resolve naming confusion
description:
## Problem

Two completely different modules are both called "query":

- **`commands/query.rs`** — Simple issue filter functions (`query_ready`, `query_by_state`, etc.)
- **`query/`** — A full boolean query DSL with lexer, parser, and evaluator (`"state:ready AND priority:high"`)

This confuses contributors and makes code navigation harder.

## Approach

After 7004d5b6 moves query functions to `domain/queries.rs`, rename `query/` to `query_engine/` (or `query_dsl/`) to clearly distinguish it:

1. Rename `crates/jit/src/query/` → `crates/jit/src/query_engine/`
2. Update `lib.rs`: `pub mod query_engine;`
3. Update all imports referencing `crate::query::` → `crate::query_engine::`
4. Update `bulk_update.rs` and any other consumers of the query DSL

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] No two modules share the "query" name
- [ ] All imports updated
- [ ] All existing tests pass
